thread.title: Clippers’ Doc Rivers calls Warriors ‘sensitive’ after luck comment
thread.title_full: Clippers’ Doc Rivers calls Warriors ‘sensitive’ after luck comment

author: SI Wire
title: Clippers’ Doc Rivers calls Warriors ‘sensitive’ after luck comment
text:
Clippers’ Doc Rivers calls Warriors ‘sensitive’ after luck comment Sports Illustrated 9 hrs ago SI Wire © Sports Illustrated los-angeles-clippers-doc-rivers-golden-state-warriors-luck-comments Los Angeles Clippers head coach Doc Rivers said Monday that he was “surprised how sensitive” the Golden State Warriors are about his comment in a recent Grantland interview, reports the Los Angeles Times’ Ben Bolch.“I’m surprised how sensitive they are about it,” Rivers said . “They are the champions, so they should just be the champions.”
AdChoices Rivers’s statement comes in response to a comment he made in a Grantland article published on Oct. 6
“You need luck in the West,” Rivers told Grantland’s Zach Lowe. “Look at Golden State. They didn’t have to play us or the Spurs .”
• Doc Rivers reflects on time with Clippers | J.J. Redick speaks to SI in Q&A
The comment triggered a slew of reactions in its immediate wake from members of the defending NBA champions. On Monday, however, Clippers center DeAndre Jordan attempted to put the feud to rest.
“We don’t have any more hatred for them than anybody else,” Jordan told the Orange County Register’s Dan Woike.
The Clippers and Warriors will play for the first time in the 2015–16 season on Nov. 4 at the Oracle Arena in Oakland.
• PREVIEWS: Can anyone top Raptors in Atlantic? | Hawks lead Southeast
- Kayla Lombardo
